body_html:
On NaN propagation:

See https://www.felixcloutier.com/x86/MINPS.html
In particular http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/bz/show_bug.cgi?id=1373
In short: SIMD max/min and std::max/std::min treat NaNs differently based on the order of the arguments.
body_text:
On NaN propagation:
See https://www.felixcloutier.com/x86/MINPS.html
In particular http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/bz/show_bug.cgi?id=1373
In short: SIMD max/min and std::max/std::min treat NaNs differently based on the order of the arguments.
body:
On NaN propagation:

See https://www.felixcloutier.com/x86/MINPS.html
In particular http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/bz/show_bug.cgi?id=1373
In short: SIMD max/min and std::max/std::min treat NaNs differently based on the order of the arguments.
